description: Single storey rear extension to existing Hotel (Use Class C1)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 1469_300 Location Plan, 1469_301 Existing and Proposed Site Plans, 1469_312_1 Existing 3rd Floor and Front / Rear Elevations, 1469_313_A Existing Side Elevations, 1469_311_A Existing 1st & 2nd Floor Plans, 1469_310_A Existing Lower Ground and Ground Floor Plan, 1469_320_A Proposed Lower Ground and Ground Floor Plan, 1469_321_A Proposed 1st & 2nd Floor Plans, 1469_322_B Proposed 3rd Floor and Front / Rear Elevations, 1469_323_B Proposed Elevations, Heritage Statement, Design and Access Statement, Transport Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | Sound Insulation of the building envelope

The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that external noise is assessed according to criteria of BS8233:2014. Measures shall be implemented prior to use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); standard 30 of the Housing SPG and London Plan (2021) policy D14.
| Extraction and Odour Control system for non-domestic kitchens

Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an odour risk assessment (according to 2018 EMAQ Guidance) and of odour abatement equipment and extract system, including operational details and maintenance schedule, the height of the extract duct, with vertical discharge outlet, without cowl, at least 1m above the eaves of the main building. Details shall be provided of a reasonable distance of the extract outlet approximately 20.0meters from any openable window. Approved details shall be implemented prior to use and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell or steam, in accordance with policies 7A and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013);  policies D4 and D11 of the London Plan(2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| Demolition and Construction
Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison, - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of existing building and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D6, D14, SI 1, T3, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby permitted shall not be commenced until detailed design and method statements (in consultation with TfL Infrastructure Protection) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority which:
1.	Approval from LU Landlord that permission has been granted for the extension and the proposals are in accordance with the lease
2.	Structural details for the proposed extension
3.	Design of foundations for the proposed rear extension.
4.	Evidence that there will be no additional loading to be transferred to LU assets
5.	RAMS for Groundworks
6.	Provide details on whether scaffold or scaffold towers will be used
7.	Provide details on what mechanised lifting devices be required
8.	RAMS for construction of extension
9.	Provide details on the arrangement for future maintenance of the extension
10.	Provide details on how the drainage will be accommodated without affecting LU operational property
11.	There should be no opening windows or balconies facing the London Underground elevation

Reason: To ensure that the development does not impact on existing London Underground transport infrastructure, in accordance with the London Plan 2021 policy T3 and 'Land for Industry and Transport' Supplementary Planning Guidance 2012.
| At least 3 secure long-stay cycle parking spaces and 2 secure short-stay cycle parking space shall be provided on site and retained thereafter.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2.
| Refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development would not be harmful to the visual amenity of the locality, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies D3 and T7 of the London Plan (2021).
